<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->
Hello,sometimes I get stuck when I perform an application installation, such as nag.
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install -v nag
```
I use the shell script to install the application in batches. When I install nag, it will jump to an interface and jam my script execution. I would like to ask if there are installation options to skip these manual operations?
The following is the content of the stuck interface.
```console

!
! A license is required to use package 'nag'.
!
! * If your system is already properly configured for such a license, save this
!   file UNCHANGED. The system may be configured if:
!
!    - A license file is installed in a default location.
!    - One of the following environment variable(s) is set for you, possibly via
!      a module file:
!
!       NAG_KUSARI_FILE
!
! * Otherwise, depending on the license you have, enter AT THE BEGINNING of
!   this file:
!
!   - the contents of your license file, or
!   - the address(es) of your license server.
!
!   After installation, the following symlink(s) will be added to point to
!   this Spack-global file (relative to the installation prefix).
!
!       lib/nag.key
!
! * For further information on licensing, see:
!
!       http://www.nag.com/doc/inun/np61/lin-mac/klicence.txt
!
! Recap:
! - You may not need to modify this file at all.
! - Otherwise, enter your license or server address AT THE BEGINNING.

```

### Information on your system
```console
$ spack debug report
```

* **Spack:** 0.16.0-77-98460b6f4
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-aarch64
* **Concretizer:** original

title: Manual operations block automated script execution
